fish
Basic explanation of words
fish
(fish)
y√∫
A type of vertebrate that lives in water, generally has scales and fins, breathes with gills, cold-blooded: fish and shrimp. Fish and insects. Fishnet. Diving. Fish in a row (sequentially like a fish swim). Fish Goose (letters, information). Yumi Township. Crow's feet. Fish eyes mixed with beads. Fish quality dragon text (Yu Xu has its own manifestations).
name.
fish
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[‚ë†]Ôºªy√∫ÔºΩ
["Guangyun" Yu Qiqi, flat fish, suspicious. ]
Traditional characters for "È±º1".
(1) Aquatic vertebrates. Body temperature changes with the outside temperature. The body is generally flat, with scales and fins. Breathe with gills. There are many types, most of which can be eaten or made into isinglass.
(2) The name of some aquatic animals like fish.
(3) A horse with white eyes.
(4) Names of acupoints in Chinese medicine. The palm (or metatarsal) bones behind the thumbs (or feet) of the fingers and hands have obvious muscle bulges, which resemble the belly of a fish.
(5) The treasures of ancient officials. Namely fish bag.
(6) Letters.
(7) Silverfish.
(8) Wooden fish.
(9) The ancient word "fishing". Fishing.
(10) The ancient word "fishing". Obtain. See "fish drink".
(11) Substitute word for the date of the message. That is six days. "Fish" is listed as the sixth rhyme of Shangping in Pingshuiyun, so it refers to six days in the telegram.
(12) Link "I". pronoun. Table first person singular.
(13) Star name. Belongs to Ojuku.
(14) Ancient country name. The old city is located in Chijia Mountain in the northeast of Fengjie, Sichuan. Yufu County was once set up in the Qin and Han Dynasties.
(15) Last name. Tang Youyu Chaoen. See "Old Tang Book¬∑The Eunuch's Biography".
fish

‚óé Fish
barracuda, fish
fish
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
„ÄêHai Collection„Äë„ÄêFish Character Department„Äë„ÄÄÈ±º; Kangxi strokes: 11; Page number: page 1480 51
